item.title: New Overwatch Hotfix Includes Balances Changes for Vendetta and All Five New Reign of Talon Heroes
item.description:
Overwatch has released another hotfix update that includes buffs for Anran, Emre, and Mizuki, as well as nerfs for Domina, Vendetta, and Jetpack Cat. These balance adjustments for the most recent six heroes to arrive in Overwatch are live in the game right now.

On February 10, Overwatch dropped the massive Season 1: Conquest update. Featuring year-long storylines, a revamped UI, and five new playable characters, Blizzard’s hero shooter has seen massive success since its soft relaunch. Then, on February 13, Overwatch released a hotfix that introduced some changes for the five Season 1 heroes, along with Vendetta, who arrived in the season prior.

Buffs for Anran, Emre, and Mizuki in Overwatch

Now, Overwatch has rolled out a second hotfix update that targets the same heroes with another set of balance adjustments. On the buffed side of things, the fiery Overwatch agent Anran received a reduction to the cooldown of Inferno Rush and an increase to the distance she can move while Dancing Blaze is active. This added mobility should help reduce the high death rate of the fragile-but-dangerous damage hero.

Who’s That Character?

Identify the silhouettes before time runs out.

5.0 s
0 / 10

Results

0

High Score: 0

—

More Games
Who’s That Character? Identify the silhouettes before time runs out.
Easy (7.5s)Medium (5.0s)Hard (2.5s)Permadeath (2.5s)
5.0 s
0 / 10
Results
0
High Score: 0 —
More Games

Emre likewise received a substantial buff, with an additional 2 damage per shot of his Synthetic Burst Rifle, which is basically Overwatch 's version of Halo 's Battle Rifle. The hero already packs a punch, but this should help make his primary weapon’s damage output comparable to full-auto hitscan heroes, like Soldier: 76 and Sojourn.

Last on the buff list is Mizuki, one of the two new Support heroes from Overwatch Reign of Talon Season 1. Kekkai Sanctuary, his ultimate ability, now lasts an extra second, making it more effective in teamfights. The Overwatch team is discussing further changes for the hero, which could include an increase in his Healing Aura range or the ability for Kekkai Sanctuary to absorb projectiles trying to leave the field as well as those that enter it.

Nerfs for Domina, Vendetta, and Jetpack Cat in Overwatch

On the other side of the balance scale stands Domina, the only new tank from the Reign of Talon Season 1 hero drop. Domina has been dominating Overwatch with her high damage and area control. To cut her down to size, her ultimate ability, Panopticon, had its cost increased by 12%, which should slow down how frequently she can launch the devastating attack.

Vendetta is the only hero on this list who wasn’t introduced in Reign of Talon Season 1, instead having arrived in Season 20 late last year. The melee damage hero has been a terror on the battlefield, with high damage and mobility. This most recent nerf reduces the damage of her overhead swing and fixes a bug that made her immune to knockbacks while launching downward with this finishing attack. This is the latest in a string of nerfs the Talon leader has received, so players will have to see if Overwatch will have to hit her again in the future.

Though Vendetta was not released in Overwatch Reign of Talon Season 1: Conquest, she plays a major role in its story, having taken over Talon and begun an offensive against Overwatch.

Lastly, Jetpack Cat – arguably the most bizarre hero Overwatch has ever released – has performed a little too well, with high damage, mobility, and aerial superiority. To compensate, the Claws Out minor perk has had its cooldown increased, and the Territorial Major Perk has had its damage bonus reduced from 50% to 33%. This is only the beginning of Jetpack Cat’s nerfs, as the Territorial Perk is expected to be completely removed in the Overwatch mid-Season 1 patch in a couple of weeks, to be replaced with something else.

Subscribe for clear patch breakdowns and hero balance insights

Get the newsletter for concise patch analysis, balance context, and actionable hero insights that explain what buffs and nerfs mean in practice. The newsletter includes patch breakdowns, developer context, and meta shifts alongside broader game coverage.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

This midseason update is expected to arrive on or around March 10 or 17, with Season 2 kicking off on April 14. There could be more hero balance hotfixes between now and then, but fans shouldn’t expect any more significant changes until then.

Overwatch Reign of Talon Season 1: Conquest Hotfix Patch Notes – February 24, 2026

Hero Balance Changes

  • Domina
    • Panopticon
      • Cost increased by 12%

  • Anran
    • Inferno Rush
      • Cooldown reduced from 8.5 to 8 seconds.

    • Dancing Blaze
      • Increased the distance you can move while active from 1.5 to 2.25 meters.

  • Emre
    • Synthetic Burst Rifle
      • Damage increased from 20 to 22.

  • Vendetta
    • Palatine Fang
      • Overhead swing damage reduced from 130 to 120.
      • Bug fix — Overhead swing can now be affected by horizontal knockback while launching downward.

  • Jetpack Cat
    • Minor Perk – Claws Out
      • Cooldown increased from 6 to 8 seconds.

    • Major Perk – Territorial
      • Damage dealt reduced from 50% to 33%.

  • Mizuki
    • Kekkai Sanctuary
      • Duration increased from 6 to 7 seconds.

Bug Fixes

  • General
    • Fixed an issue with missing textures on the Charming: 76 skin.
    • Fixed some minor issues with Jetpack Cat and the tether animation for various heroes.
    • Fixed an issue that hid Jetpack Cat’s aim‑assist strength and threshold settings.
    • Fixed an issue with Vendetta’s sword‑throw animation in third person.
    • Fixed an issue where Mizuki could still perform Katashiro Return while stunned.
    • Fixed an issue where Mercy's passive displayed incorrectly in the Advanced Info Panel.

  • Stadium
    • Fixed an issue causing the Stadium UI to disappear after a round transition.
    • Fixed an issue where Vendetta could spam her ultimate power without a full charge.
    • Fixed an issue where Vendetta would not receive ultimate charge while using the “Overloaded” strike power.
    • Fixed an issue where Vendetta's Primary Fire would not trigger Gloomgauntlet or be increased by Melee Damage.
    • Fixed an issue where the VFX for Bola Shot when using Freja’s “So Cooked” power were incorrect.
    • Fixed an issue with Ana’s “Dreamy” power that incorrectly canceled the benefits of Artsy Daisy and Tactical Rifle.
    • Fixed an issue where Mercy's Self Healing from healing allies with missing health was incorrectly reduced to 15% instead of the intended 40%.

6 /10

Overwatch (Formerly Overwatch 2)

OVERWATCH®, A FUTURE WORTH FIGHTING FOR! Overwatch® is an always-on and ever-evolving free-to-play, team-based action game set in an optimistic future.

Overwatch® is an always-on and ever-evolving free-to-play, team-based hero shooter game set in an optimistic future, where every match is the ultimate 5v5 or 6v6 battlefield brawl featuring new heroes and maps, different ways to play, and unique cosmetics! Lead the charge, ambush your enemies, or aid your allies as one of Overwatch’s 40+ distinct heroes. Team up with friends, take them into battle across 25+ futuristic maps inspired by real-world locations, and master multiple unique game modes.

Reign of Talon - Season 1: Conquest
The Next Big Story Begins

The world shifts as 2026 begins a year-long narrative arc where Overwatch and Talon face off in the fight for the future, joined by five new Heroes at once. Step into the story and shape what comes next!

After ten years, Season 1 opens the first chapter of Overwatch's next big story, where your choices will put you right into the fight for the future!

For the first time, five new Heroes hit the roster together, bringing new playstyles, new dynamics, and new voices into the fray all at once. Jet Pack Cat, Anran, Domina, Emre, and Mizuki arrive just in time for Reign of Talon: Conquest, launching a year-long narrative where conflict takes center stage and you contribute to how it unfolds.

Choose where you stand as Overwatch and Talon collide in a faction-driven event with outcomes that will leave visible marks on the world and your legacy. Along the way, Competitive gets a refresh and Core gameplay evolves, changing how things feel across the board.

This season sets a fresh tone for how the Overwatch story is told and how you play it.

item.title: Borderlands 4 Players Have New Codes That They Can Redeem Right Now
item.description:
Borderlands 4 players have a fresh batch of SHiFT Codes that are available to be redeemed right now. However, alongside the usual offering of Golden Keys, there’s plenty of extra goodies up for grabs. As is the case with all ShiFT rewards in Borderlands 4 , these codes won’t stick around forever, so players who want a quick injection of high-tier gear and loot may want to act sooner rather than later.

Borderlands 4 is a looter-shooter developed by Gearbox Software and published by 2K Games. Players can choose from one of four Vault Hunters and embark on a journey across the new planet of Kairos. SHiFT Code drops offer players plenty of loot to spice up adventuring.

New SHiFT Codes For Golden Keys and a Skin

There are a few new SHiFT Codes alongside the bevy of existing codes that remain active. The first is WH533-JXC9R-BSKSW-Z3BJB-RHJ55 for one Golden Key. However, to earn the reward, players must link 2K account on the ShiFT Code site. The expiration date is unknown . The next code is BH633-66F5C-WFBB5-33TJB-CBSR9 , which provides the You're So Vein skin for all Vault Hunters. This code expires on December 31, 2030 .

According to regularly updated SHiFT Code lists, these previously released codes are still active and ready to be redeemed:

  • JZF3T-T36HB-KX3BK-33J33-HTS3Z – 1 Golden Key. Expiration unknown
  • T9RJB-BFKRR-3RBTW-B33TB-KCZB9 – 1 Golden Key. No expiration
  • J9XTB-SJWS3-WRTTC-BJTJJ-TH6TX – A Winter Borderland skin for Echo-4. Expires December 31, 2030 .
  • J96JT-BCXKT-C6JJ5-JTJBB-BZTXJ – Maliwannabee skin for Harlowe. Expires December 31, 2030 .
  • BZ6JJ-CB6CT-WXJJW-3TT3B-56FZ5 – Mass Market Appeal skin for Vex. Expires January 1, 2031 .
  • JZ6BJ-SBR5J-WF3BK-BT3BB-TX9HB – Cult Classic skin for Amon. Expires December 31, 2030 .
  • TZXT3-XJXCB-CXBJW-BTTJT-9SK6B – Savings Savior skin for Rafa. Expires December 31, 2030 .
  • THFB3-R9XKK-CFBJW-T33BB-9R3CC – Gourd Your Loins Head for all Vault Hunters and Hex Appeal Weapon Skin. Expires December 31, 2030 .
  • 39FJB-CT5S3-5FTTW-BBB3J-F3HKZ – Hype Squad skin for all Vault Hunters. Expires December 31, 2030 .
  • 3HX3J-RJWSJ-CFBBC-3BJ3B-RWZ36 – A Winter Borderland skin for all Vault Hunters. Expires December 31, 2030 .
  • BZ6J3-3JKHB-CX3B5-TTJTT-HJBZW – The World On His Shoulders skin for all Vault Hunters. Expires December 31, 2030 .
  • 3ZXJB-HZBHT-KX3BK-BBTT3-BHHXJ – Children Of The Vex skin for all Vault Hunters. Expires December 31, 2030 .
  • 3S6BB-ZXT93-KRT3W-BT3T3-JW6TZ – Halloween-themed cosmetic items for all Vault Hunters. Expires January 1, 2031 .
  • JS63J-JSCWJ-CFTBW-3TJ3J-WJS5R – Break Free Pack including Break Free skin for all Vault Hunters, Break Free Echo-4 skin, Kn0x Echo-4 skin, and Firebreak Legendary Shield. Expires January 1, 2031 .

Most of the above codes have a stated expiration date of December 31 or January 1st, but in 2030 and 2031. That's the case for a lot of the cosmetic rewards, like Vault Hunter and Exho-4 skins. However, most of the Golden Keys do not have listed expiration dates. For the skins that are available for all characters, it’s unclear if they will be usable on new Vault Hunters like C4sh.

SHiFT Codes in Borderlands 4 are redeemable by players for Golden Keys and other cosmetic rewards in-game. Those Golden Keys can then be used on Golden Chests in certain questing hubs like The Launchpad to receive a shower of loot that’s scaled to a player’s current level. They are completely free gifts available to any and all players that manage to redeem the code before it’s no longer active. Redeeming SHiFT Codes is a straightforward process. Players can enter them directly through the SHiFT tab in the in-game Social menu or via the SHiFT website. Once accepted, rewards are typically delivered through the in-game mail system and can be claimed at the player’s convenience.

SHiFT Codes have long been a staple of the Borderlands ecosystem, offering everything from Golden Keys in Borderlands 4 to limited-time cosmetics. While the codes above are currently active, Gearbox frequently rotates its offerings, and expiration dates can vary. That makes timely redemption important, especially for players who don’t want to miss out on easy loot. While some may point out that there are better ways to reward player retention, it’s hard to argue against something that has a proven track record of working.

As Borderlands 4 continues to present updates through 2026, new SHiFT Codes are likely to follow. As always, interested players can keep an eye on official social media accounts and in-game messaging to spot any additional SHiFT Codes Gearbox shares directly. For now, Vault Hunters have fresh opportunities to pad their inventory and even pick up a new look — with no grinding required.

8 /10

Borderlands 4

item.title: I'm Already Mourning Phasmophobia's March 3 Update
item.description:
It's November 2024. An old friend of mine reached out to me and told me to download Phasmophobia so we can play it together. Of course, I had heard about the game beforehand, given that Phasmophobia has been in early access since 2020, but it had recently come to consoles in October. We hadn't really had a game to play together since the heydays of Apex Legends , so I downloaded the game, and the following weeks saw a reunion of The Boys (not to be confused with the comic series).

My high school friends and I had a new game to play, and because of that, it would easily become my most-played game of 2025. There's a good chance it stays my most played game for this year (or at least I don't see it falling out of the top 10). We spent weeks getting good at the game, with most of us having a couple of levels of prestige under our belt. Every co-op Phasmophobia session is filled with incredibly dumb antics. We went from playing every night around dinner for weeks to playing a couple of times a week to now, where we play once a week or so. That's just natural, given the sheer number of hours we've put into the game, and now, Phasmophobia's 6 Tanglewood Drive rework releases on March 3. I've welcomed every map rework it's pursued recently, but this one hurts.

Why Phasmophobia is Reworking Tanglewood

Developer Kinetic Games has given a few looks at the map and outlined its goals/why it's even reworking Tanglewood. It wants to bring up the visuals and gameplay of Tanglewood, making it more comparable to recent Phasmophobia maps and reworks, boost the replay value of the map, and align it with the studio's vision for the game's future full release. Part of this endeavor is to remove the various stock assets still in the game, which is understandable. On paper, I fully understand why Kinetic Games is reworking Tanglewood, but on paper, Kinetic Games has always known this would upset portions of the fanbase.

Alongside the release date announcement for Tanglewood's rework, Kinetic Games reiterated that:

"We knew when we announced that 6 Tanglewood Drive would be getting a rework, it would be a hot topic amongst the community due to its popularity and the place it holds in players’ hearts. With the work now done on this new version, we believe we’ve only improved on what makes the map so special."

This message is directly for me, and players like me, or especially those who have been playing longer than me. And while I understand the desire and need to fix it, I don't think changing a map can "improve" what makes it special. Tanglewood isn't special because of its specific framing, but because my friends and I spent weeks on the map improving our skills at the game, because we know that map like the back of our hand, and because it is the warm-up map for any session of Phasmophobia . It might still be and I am trying to reserve judgment, but you can't manufacture what made Tanglewood special.

If there's a realm of possibility where players could keep/access Old Tanglewood and New Tanglewood, I think that's the easiest solution. At the very least, I hope Old Tanglewood comes back a few times throughout the year.

Who’s That Character?

Identify the silhouettes before time runs out.

5.0 s
0 / 10

Results

0

High Score: 0

—

More Games
Who’s That Character? Identify the silhouettes before time runs out.
Easy (7.5s)Medium (5.0s)Hard (2.5s)Permadeath (2.5s)
5.0 s
0 / 10
Results
0
High Score: 0 —
More Games

Tanglewood's Rework Looks Fine, But It Doesn't Look Like Tanglewood

If you told me the images released of New Tanglewood so far were a completely different map, I'd believe you. The front of the house is largely the same, but the hallway looks completely different, the living room looks like it's from a completely different era, the kitchen's looping spot is gone, and the van (that has annoyed me for years when the ghost starts honking it) is replaced by a completely different car. I don't even know about the nursery that has saved me from a Phasmophobia ghost hundreds of times since I first started playing.

At first glance, Phasmophobia 's changes to Tanglewood just don't align with me. Maybe when it releases, I will feel different—I was on board with Phasmophobia 's other map reworks since their announcement—but the changes are much bigger than I expected when it was first mentioned.

Kinetic Games says that it sought to "keep the core design of the house as familiar as possible," so there aren't any drastic layout changes (outside the Kitchen), and that "the redesign has given 6 Tanglewood Drive a much richer personality introduced through new interactions and landmarks that players will notice from their first steps inside."

Kinetic Games has also said that there is a host of new audio features in Phasmophobia for Tanglewood and that there are still "excellent locations" within Tanglewood to loop ghosts. Apparently, there is even a dryer jingle. The expanding audio features make perfect sense to me, as well as adding brand new interactions, but just...the New Tanglewood is not Old Tanglewood.

Subscribe for deeper Phasmophobia map coverage

Signing up for the newsletter provides thoughtful coverage of Phasmophobia’s Tanglewood rework, player reactions, and developer perspective — analysis and context that help you weigh what's lost, what's gained, and how map changes reshape familiar play.
By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

So, I'm firmly on the side of the fanbase that Kinetic Games knew would be upset by major changes to Tanglewood. I get it, but I don't like it. But when the Tanglewood rework drops, I have no doubt my friends and I will check it out. I just don't know if it will capture the same magic. We've, of course, talked about it from the teasers that have released so far, and we run the full gamut of opinions. I am, perhaps, on the extreme end of not liking it, while another friend is on the extreme end of being open to it. The others are somewhere in the middle, and if anything, the way our pendulum swings represents how important Phas as a game is to us. We all want what's best because we love it so much.

Kinetic Games is saying "Trust," and while I am immediately hesitant about this, I'm choosing to trust that what makes Tanglewood special is not gone. I just know I am going to miss Old Tanglewood, no matter how much I like or dislike New Tanglewood. I can also guarantee I'll be spending plenty of time in Tanglewood until March 3.

Source: Kinetic Games

Phasmophobia

item.title: Some PS5 Gamers Will Get to Play the Next Horizon Game This Weekend
item.description:
The Horizon franchise is about to shake things up with its upcoming spin-off Horizon Hunters Gathering , and curious fans will get to check it out this weekend during the game's first playtest. Horizon Hunters Gathering is an upcoming co-op live-service game set in the Horizon universe, and gamers are about to get the first sneak peek into what the game has to offer.

Horizon Hunters Gathering was announced at the beginning of February, and it already looks like a huge departure from the PlayStation exclusive series' usual formula. From a different, more stylized art style to its live-service approach, this new Horizon multiplayer game is a surprising turn for the franchise. There have been rumors and leaks about a multiplayer Horizon game for a while now, and Horizon Hunters Gathering making its surprise debut shows that Guerrilla Games has indeed been working on a co-op project.

Horizon Hunters Gathering is Hosting Its First Closed Playtest This Weekend

  • The playtest will run from Friday, February 27 to Sunday, March 1.
  • Both PS5 and PC users will be allowed into the test.
  • PC users will access the game via Steam.

Since this playtest is closed, it means that only those who are part of the PlayStation beta program are eligible to try out the game. There is still some time to sign up ahead of the playtest's launch. Once Friday gets here, though, it won't be possible to sign up, so Horizon fans who are interested will want to act fast. Also, Horizon Hunters Gathering 's playtest isn't available to all countries. Only gamers in North America and Europe will be able to participate. As the wait for more Horizon 3 news continues, Horizon Hunters Gathering is the first piece of Horizon content that fans have gotten in a while.

North American servers are planned to be open from 4pm to 7pm Pacific Time. European servers will be live between 7pm and 10pm Central European Time.

Balance the critic averages

More Games

There is still a lot of mystery surrounding Horizon Hunters Gathering . A co-op Horizon spin-off is a bold step away from the series' single-player narrative-driven approach, but Guerrilla Games has at least offered a few insights into what to expect. The game supports up to three players, or Hunters, while the gameplay is tactical and skill-based. The Hunters that players will be able to choose during the playtest are named Axle, Sun, and Rem. There are also two confirmed game modes. Machine Incursion is a wave-based mode, and Cauldron Descent is a multi-stage dungeon exploration mode. Both are confirmed to be part of the upcoming playtest, as well.

Horizon Hunters Gathering is Going to Be Canon to the Larger Horizon Universe

One of the main things that makes Horizon Hunters Gathering so intriguing is that it's going to play a part in Horizon 's ongoing narrative. Guerrilla Games' official press release for the game states, "The game has a narrative campaign which will introduce new mysteries, characters, and threats, but we’re keeping it under wraps for now. What we can say is that Hunters Gathering is fully canon and its story doesn’t stop at launch!" Once the game releases, it will be interesting to see how it expands the Horizon franchise lore.

The Horizon Hunters Gathering playtest is also happening at a strange time. Sony is hosting the Marathon Server Slam this weekend, too. Marathon 's journey to the finish line has been filled with obstacles, and Horizon Hunters Gathering has left some franchise fans frustrated that a live-service multiplayer spin-off is getting released before Horizon 3 . So, it will be fascinating to see what the feedback to both games ends up being after the weekend is over.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Season 2 Meta Weapon Tier List
item.description:
Battlefield 6 has finally entered its second season after a long-anticipated wait, kicking off the next line of content drops. At launch, players can hop into Contaminated, the new map for the season, along with extra content for RedSec , including Battle Royale Synthesis, which throws players into a unique spin on Battle Royale with the introduction of the VL-7 Strike Gas.

While more content will be rolling out in the various phases of Season 2, at launch, players can wield a bunch of new weapons along with reaping the rewards of fine-tuning to recoil on every weapon across the board. These updates have seriously shifted the meta for Battlefield 6 , so to get ahead of the competition, here is a meta tier list ranking every weapon in Battlefield 6 Season 2.

S-Tier: God Tier Weapons

Weapons

Reason For Meta Ranking

M433

Best all-around Assault Rifle for all purposes. Solid accuracy and a high rate of fire.

Kord 6P67

Still a top-ranking Assault Rifle for Season 2. It has very low recoil and is exceptionally stable, making it very easy to use.

DRS-IAR

Accurate and heavy-hitting LMG that handles more like an Assault Rifle. Excellent for the long-range meta.

M123K

A fast-firing LMG that received a significant recoil control buff. It is relatively stable and boasts a large magazine, excellent for kill chains from up close and afar.

AK4D

Hard-hitting Assault Rifle. Boasts some kick but is excellent for long range when built for recoil control.

VCR-2

Newest weapon to Season 2 and the best Assault Rifle for close-to-mid range. High rate of fire, solid TTK, and a larger magazine than the TR-7

PW5A3

All-around best SMG. Boasts a solid TTK along with excellent accuracy that rivals many other weapons. Ideal SMG for close-to-mid range.

NVO-228E

Excellent, steady rifle with serious damage. Though controllable, it does have a little bit of recoil deviation to get a hold of.

Mini Scout

Best Sniper Rifle in terms of mobility and fire rate. Though dealing less damage, it is the only Sniper capable of rechambering whilst in ADS.

A-Tier: Absolute Meta Weapons

Weapons

Reason For Meta Ranking

B36A4

Excellent and easy to use Assault Rifle. Relatively low recoil and stable for medium-to-long range.

SGX

Fast killing SMG with a blistering fire rate. Almost no vertical recoil and does not suffer from a small magazine size like some other high DPS SMGs.

M240L

The fastest-killing LMG up close and carries a solid TTK at long range. It does boast a fair amount of bloom, however.

RPKM

Fairly easy to control with a predictable recoil pattern. Boasts a solid TTK and is a heavy hitter. Ideal for long-range engagements.

M277

Relatively low damage drop-off at long range, with a massive buff to recoil control in Season 2. Still requires some overhaul to reduce its upward kick, however.

KV9

Arguably the fastest-killing SMG up close if all bullets hit their mark. Incredibly high skill weapon, thanks to its low magazine size.

SG 553R

Moderate fire rate with a high level of damage. Though often slept on, it is an excellent close-to-mid-range Carbine that can outclass a lot of SMGs and ARs.

GRT-CPS

Excellent DMR that is new to Season 2. While it is not the hardest-hitting of the category, it boasts a solid fire rate, excellent accuracy, and fast recentering.

QBZ-192

Fairly controllable recoil, mostly kicking upward, and a great TTK.

M4A1

Still a high-ranking Carbine. Fast fire rate and a decent level of control. Ideal for medium-range gunfights.

TR-7

Excellent close-to-mid range Assault Rifle with a fast TTK. Only limited by its small magazine size.

M250

No damage drop-off at all at long range, and while the damage itself is not the highest, the fact that it does not fall off makes it one of the best LMGs damage-wise from a distance.

M2010 ESR

Excellent Sniper Rifle for all scenarios. Has the second-best level of bullet velocity, is decently quick, and excellent for 75 to 120 meters.

M357 Trait

By far the best secondary in the game. A little less damage than the M44 but a better fire rate. A reliable two-shot kill and holds more rounds.

M44

Arguably the second-best secondary. Excellent stopping power and can one-shot to the head. Harsh recoil and low fire rate, however.

B-Tier: Solid Meta Choices

Weapons

Reason For Meta Ranking

AK-205

By far the easiest full-auto weapon to use in the game. Boasts almost zero recoil and can be used for all ranges. The only caveat is its relatively low damage compared to faster killing options.

M417 A2

Powerful long-range Carbine that packs a serious punch. Suffers from a low-magazine size, however.

GRT-BC

Comparable to the QBZ-192 and often faster killing. Great hipfire spread, but boasts bouncy recoil and spread. More suitable for close-range gunfights.

USG-90

Boasts a fast TTK and a decent amount of recoil control to boot. Also, it has the largest magazine in the category, perfect for taking on multiple opponents.

L110

Excellent beginner LMG. Middle of the pack TTK but fairly easy to control. Excellent for crowd control at medium range.

M1014

Boasts the second-best level of damage to the Shotgun class, but a higher fire rate. One of the best TTKs up close and has a damage range comparable to the M87A1.

M87A1

Best damage-per-shot of the Shotgun class. More than capable of gaining consistent one-shot kills up close and offers the best range.

SCW-10

Mathematically, it is the second-fastest killing SMG in the game. Limited by its small magazine size, with its extended magazine attachments offering fairly little ammo boosts. Incredibly highly skilled weapon.

L85A3

Steady Assault Rifle with a decent level of control for medium to long range. However, its damage is on the low end and is outclassed by most Assault Rifles.

SOR-556 MK2

Fairly low recoil and accurate, but its damage and fire rate are on the low end when compared to most Assault Rifles.

PSR

Has the best muzzle velocity of the Sniper Rifle category. It's ideal for extreme long ranges, but has less control and speed than other options.

SVK-8.6

Considerably a decent DMR. Slow-firing and hard-hitting, and much easier to control thanks to the slower fire rate, it is a guaranteed two-shot kill at all ranges. Ideal for long range, but not great up close.

M45A1

Slowest fire rate of the semi-auto secondaries, but it packs a punch with serious damage up close.

C-Tier: Niche Weapon Options

Weapons

Reason For Meta Ranking

SOR-300SC

It boasts the lowest fire rate of the Carbines, but is tied with many for high damage. Decent for close-range fights due to its low velocity, but not exactly a standout gun for the category.

PW7A2

Relatively low damage per-shot paired with a high fire rate. Low recoil and extremely accurate, but it is outclassed by a fair number of other SMGs in TTK.

UMG-40

Extremely low recoil. Excellent versatility at medium range for an SMG, but not exactly the fastest killing option, ranking behind most options, including the PW5A3.

M/60

Heavy-hitting LMG built for long-range gunfights. However, the horizontal spread of the weapon is hard to control, requiring attachment overhauls to tone it down.

KTS100 MK8

Low recoil and ideal for long-range. Arguably the slowest killing of the LMG category, however.

SL9

Has a slightly better TTK than options like the UMG-40 and is highly accurate for mid-range. However, its hipfire accuracy and precision take a hit.

M121 A2

Boasts a solid TTK for an LMG. However, its recoil is definitely on the harsh side, with quite a bit of climb and horizontal spread.

18.5KS-K

It has the highest fire rate of the Shotgun category. Excellent TTK at close range, but has the second-poorest level of range.

SV-98

Not a bad Sniper Rifle by any means. It is more tailored to shorter-range fights, but that particular niche is filled by the Mini Scout. It does boast better damage-per-shot, however.

LMR27

Easily the best DMR for mid-range fights. Is notably beaten by most full-auto weapons, however.

SVDM

High damage paired with a faster-than-average fire rate. Much harder to use from a distance, though.

ES 5.7

Best bullet velocity in the secondary class and superfast fire rate. Not exactly the best secondary option, but still a decent consideration.

GGH-22

Better damage range than the ES 5.7 and dishes out a little more damage, but with a slower rate of fire. Notably, less bullet velocity, however.

D-Tier: Lowest Ranking Weapons

Weapons

Reason For Meta Ranking

DB-12

It has a faster fire rate than the only other pump Shotgun thanks to the fact that it fires two rounds before rechambering. However, it has the lowest range of the category.

M39 EMR

Second-best bullet velocity. Decent for long-range encounters and a good magazine size to boot. However, it aims to fill a niche that is already taken.

P18

Similar damage profile to the ES 5.7, but with a notably slower fire rate. Rapid damage fall-off, and the fact that it aims to fill a contested niche, hold this secondary back compared to other options.

Battlefield 6
9 /10
